response.feedback: Incorrect. This is not a legitimate probability distribution of X. For example, using this formula, we'll get: P(X = 2) = 2, which is not a number between 0 and 1, as it should be.

Good job! Using this formula, we'll get P(X = 1) = (5 - 1) / 10 = 0.4, P(X = 2) = (5 - 2) / 10 = 0.3, P(X = 3) = (5 - 3) / 10 = 0.2, P(X = 4) = (5 - 4) / 10 = 0.1, which is exactly the one represented by the histogram above.
